embed.title: Basic Formtion
embed.description: Tips on basic formation for new players.

fields.name: Basics
fields.value:
• Prioritize the front-line. Put your best melee troops in the first two rows.
• Put your ranged units in the middle to protect them.
• Put some defense at the back row.
• Form an archer wall so your back defenders would stay at the back.

fields.name: Value Troops
fields.value:
__Undead Soldier__: fast-moving, high-attack troops that can revive once. Put them in the front. If you have spare units, put some in the back.
__Magic Apprentices__: fast back-line attackers who can deal AoE damage. Put them in the front so they can reach enemy's back faster.
__Goblikazes__: self-exploding units that can weaken enemy's front line. Put them in the first and last rows.
__Ghost Assassins__: fast-attacking units that blink to the enemy's back. Position them so they can trigger enemy's back-row Goblikazes.
__Ballista__: powerful range units that deal damage to multiple units in a straight line. They have limited ranges, so put them in row 2-3 if possible.
__Ice Mages__: powerful long-range units that deal damage to multiple units in a circle.
__Archers__: fast-attacking long-range units.

fields.name: Filler Troops
fields.value: Ogre Warrior, Paladin, Harbinger of Fire, Bandits, and Cactuses are useful placeholder troops for beginners.

footer.text: For more tips, use `?formation intermediate`, `?formation leveling`
